shortdesc.i: This event is fired by the system. If you want to listen to the event you can do so using the document.addEventListener function and remove the listener using the document.removeEventListener function. The keyboardClosed event is triggered when the virtual keyboard has finished sliding out of view of the application.

dd.p: The callback function that will be invoked on the keyboardClosed event.

p.pre:
<script type="text/javascript">

                function onKeyboardClosed() {
                    console.log("Keyboard closed event occured.");
                }

                document.addEventListener("keyboardClosed", onKeyboardClosed);

                </script>
